H0.text: A woodpecker nesting in a cavity of a dead tree is the best example of a parasitic relationship.

H1.text: A tapeworm absorbing food in the digestive tract of a wolf is the best example of a parasitic relationship.

H2.text: A polar bear hunting a seal for food is the best example of a parasitic relationship.

H3.text: A hummingbird transferring pollen between flowers is the best example of a parasitic relationship.

A4.text: Classic examples include interactions between vertebrate hosts and tapeworms, flukes, and those between the malaria-causing Plasmodium species, and fleas.

A5.text: Predation is by definition not a symbiosis, as the interaction is brief.
